subclusters.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Feedback Theory
Oxidative Damage Accumulation to Proteins and Lifespan Correlation

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage and the role of superoxide dismutase (SOD) and catalase enzyme balance in modulating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SIRT3-mediated activation of mitochondrial SOD2 and calorie restriction effects on oxidative stress defense.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative damage by free radicals and modulation of antioxidant enzymes influencing lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on pharmacological upregulation of endogenous antioxidant enzymes like SOD and catalase to reduce oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses age-related changes in antioxidant systems and their protective role against ROS-induced damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Correlates survival during aging with induction of antioxidant enzymes such as SOD, glutathione reductase, and ascorbate.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights brain antioxidant enzyme induction and antioxidant/prooxidant balance affecting survival and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, antioxidant enzyme decline with age, and metabolic rate dependency of oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses species, strain, and sex differences in oxidative stress response and antioxidant enzyme roles in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Examines gender differences in ROS homeostasis and antioxidant defenses influencing lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes roles of SOD enzymes in mitigating ROS and RNS damage and evolutionary adaptations managing oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Regulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS accumulation, antioxidant defenses, and mitochondrial/cytosolic ROS production in vascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondria as major ROS source, ROS-induced damage to biomolecules, and antioxidant enzyme roles in lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial hydrogen peroxide production, inverse correlation with lifespan, and pro-oxidant/antioxidant balance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondria as primary ROS source, oxidative damage feedback loop involving mtDNA damage accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links glutathione levels, mitochondrial function, glucose-dependent ROS production, and aging in yeast.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights accumulation of somatic damage by ROS, DNA damage as critical factor, and mitochondrial ROS in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormesis and Stress Response Modulation in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hormesis, dietary antioxidants as hormetic agents, and vitagenes regulating stress responses delaying aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Repair and Methionine Sulfoxide Reductase Mechanism
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on methionine sulfoxide reductases (MsrA and MsrB) repairing oxidized methionine residues and their differential effects on aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage Accumulation to Proteins and Lifespan Correlation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes protein oxidation accumulation, species differences in susceptibility, and decline in antioxidative defenses with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage Accumulation to Proteins and Lifespan Correlation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes protein oxidation as marker and driver of aging and dietary restriction reducing oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage Accumulation to Proteins and Lifespan Correlation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on protein carbonyl content as oxidative damage marker and spin-trapping compounds reducing damage and lifespan effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative DNA damage accumulation, 8-hydroxy-2'-deoxyguanosine as biomarker, and decline in DNA repair with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative DNA damage, metabolic rate correlation with lifespan, antioxidant defense, and mitogenesis accelerating mutagenesis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related oxidative DNA damage, decline in mitochondrial efficiency, antioxidant defenses, and DNA repair.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metal-Dependent Flavonoid Activation and Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metal ion catalysis of ROS formation, flavonoid prooxidant activation, and PaMTH1 methyltransferase protecting against oxidative stress.
